Package DataModel.TransportationData.StopData

Class Line

java.lang.Object
DataModel.TransportationData.StopData.Line
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Comparator<Line>
public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<Line>
Class: java.DataModel.TransportationData.StopData.Line

This class store the information of a bus line that stops at a specific stop, offering the ability to compare it with other bus lines that stop at the same stop.

Furthermore, it allows us to read and modify the information of each line.

This class is used to know the bus wait time at a specific stop, so each object of this class will store the id of the stop and the name of the bus line, then it will have the time left for this this bus to arrive at the stop in minutes.

This class fills its attributes with information using the class JsonLineReader . This class implements the Comparator interface in order to be able to sort the different bus lines that stop at the specified station according to their time left to arrive at the stop.

In order to do that the class implements the method compare that compares two bus lines according to their TimeLeftMin.

This class also has two constructing methods, one default constructing method that does not take any parameters and initializes all attributes, and another copy constructor that take another object form the class Line and constructs a new Line object with the same information.

Additionally, this class has getters and setters for all attributes so it would be possible to fill the attributes with information, and print it when needed

    • compare

      public int compare​(Line o1, Line o2)
      compares two Line according to how much time left for the Line to arrive at the station
      Specified by:
      compare in interface java.util.Comparator<Line>
      Parameters:
      o1 - the first Line to be compared
      o2 - the second Line to be compared
      Returns:
      a positive integer if the second Line will come sooner, a negative integer if the first Line will come sooner, a zero if both times are equal
